body_text.text: 19K is shown in the third and fourth panels. Results show that the expression of the AdV-D8 145 19K protein is less effective at inducing XBP1s than AdV-C2 19K. Source data are provided as 146 a source data file. 147
j. Multiple sequence alignment shows high sequence conservation between C2 and C5 19K of 148
AdV-C2 and C5 (92%), and considerable variation between C2/5 and D8 19K (30% conserved 149 residues). Clustal 1.2.4 web server was used to align the sequences.

FIGREF0.text: showing the genomic locus targeted by the guide RNA for the construction of 14 IRE1α knock-out HeLa cells (HeLa I-KO) by CRISPR-Cas9. 15 b. Mutations in the monoclonal HeLa I-KO cells introduced by CRISPR/Cas9 to the three 16 alleles of IRE1α in HeLa cells. An insertion of an adenosine (A), and a 23-nucleotide (nt) 17 deletion, respectively, resulted in out-of-frame modifications, whereas a 15-nt deletion caused 18 an in-frame deletion. 19 c. Cell-associated AdV-C5 and nuclear import of incoming viral DNA are not affected in HeLa 20 I-KO cells (n=15 for HeLa and n=12 for HeLa I-KO). Nuclear vDNA was scored as hexon-free 21 vDNA puncta over the DAPI mask. Centre line of the box plot indicates median with 1 st and 3 rd 22 quartiles and whiskers shown as boxes and lines, respectively. Significance was assessed 23 with two-tailed Wilcoxon non-parametric test. Scale bar, 10 µm. 24 d. XBP1 splicing assay and the formula to determine the percentage of spliced XBP1 {Han, 25 2009, 19665977}. The T7 endonuclease removes the hybrid XBP-1u-1s band (*) above the 1s 26 band (two panels on the right). Four independent experiments gave similar results. 27 e. XBP1 splicing is enhanced in AdV-C2 and C5 infection of HeLa cells (MOI 75). * denotes a 28 background product. Three independent experiments gave similar results. Source data are 29 provided as a source data file. 30 f. Splicing of XBP1s induced by Golgicide A (GCA) requires IRE1α. HeLa I-KO cells show 31 lesser XBP1 splicing than wild type HeLa cells upon 5 h incubation with GCA (20 µM). Three 32 independent experiments gave similar results. 33 g. Induction of XPB1s occurs in AdV-C5 infected WI38 cells (MOI 75).

FIGREF1.text: mRNA levels were measured relative to GAPDH and TBP. Data present the 44 means +/-SD from three independent experiments. Source data are provided as a 50) in the presence or absence of the viral replication inhibitor cytosine arabinoside 79 (AraC, 16 μM) {Yamashita, 1974, 4850436}. Ethynyl-cytosine (EdC, 2.5 μM) was added for 4 h 80 before fixation 24 h pi. Viral replication centers with incorporated EdC were stained with azide-81 Alexa488 by copper-catalyzed click reaction, and imaged by high-throughput microscopy 82 including DAPI for the cell nuclei (left panel). Scale bar, 50 µm. Inhibition of AdV replication did 83 not affect E1A expression (middle panel). Parallel samples with the same amount of virus and 84 AraC was lysed at 24 h pi and immunoblotted with the anti-E1A antibody M73, or analysed for 85 XBP1 splicing (right panel). * denotes a background product. Three independent experiments 86 gave similar results. Source data are provided as a source data file. 87 b. HeLa cells were infected with AdV-C5 (MOI 50) in the presence of AraC (16 μM) and 88 flavopiridol (FLV) (250 nM) for 24 h. Cells were fixed and stained with an anti-E1A antibody 89 (M58) and parallel samples were used for XBP1 splicing assay. Scale bar, 50 µm. Two 90 independent experiments gave similar results. Source data are provided as a source data file. 91 c. Schematic of AdV-C5 mutants dl327 and dl309 and their respective regions of deletion (top 92 panel). Mutant dl309 has deletion in the E3B locus and dl327 has most of the E3A and E3B 93 loci deleted. HeLa cells were infected with equivalent amounts of median physical virus 94 particles of C5, C5-dl327 and C5-dl309 and stained for E1A (M58) and 19K (Tw1.3) 24 h pi. 95 Scale bar, 50 µm. For verification of the deleted region, PCR was performed with the indicated 96 primers, followed by sequencing of the PCR fragment (bottom right panel). Note that the dl309 97 mutant contains stuffer DNA in place of E3B genes, and shows an approximate reduction of 98 100 bp in the diagnostic PCR band. Three independent experiments gave similar results. 99 d. Deletion of 19K reduces XBP1 induction by AdV-C5. AdV-C5 wild-type and mutant with 100 deletion in 19K gene was used to infect HeLa cells (MOI 100 each). Samples were collected 101 and analysed for XBP1 splicing at 24 and 48h post infection. Results from two different 102 experiments are plotted in the graph. Right panel shows the absence of 19K expression in 103 AdV-C5-d19K virus. Data present the means from two independent experiments. Source data 104 are provided as a source data file. 105 e. RNAi against E3 reduces 19K levels and IRE1α activation as measured by XBP1s (left 106 panel). HeLa cells were transfected with 10 nM siPools against the 19K of AdV-C5 for 48 h, 107 and infected with AdV-C5 (MOI 75) for 24 h. Cells were either fixed with PFA quartiles and whiskers shown as boxes and lines, respectively. Test of significance 111 was performed with two-tailed Wilcoxon non-parametric test. Scale bar, 100 µm. siPools 112 against the E4 locus of AdV-C5 showed no effect on virus induction of XBP1s. Representative 113 images visualizing 19K and GFP-E4orf4 show the specificity of E3 and E4 RNAi in AdV-C5 114 and AdV-C5_GFP-E4orf4 infections at MOI 75 and 150, respectively. Scale bar, 100 µm. 115 Source data are provided as a source data file. 116 f. Expression constructs of the E3A region and mutants used in this study. Premature 117 termination of E3A region genes by the insertion of dual stop codons TAATAG after the 118 initiating methionine was performed for the 12.5K, 7.1K, 19K and ADP open reading frames. A 119 further deletion of the transmembrane domain of ADP was included to prevent the expression 120 of truncation forms. Experiment showing the activation of IRE1α (XBP1 splicing) by the 12.5K 121 STOP mutant was performed as described in Figure 3c. Source data are provided as a source 122 data file. 123 g. Schematic of AdV-C2 19K lumenal domain (LD) deletion construct, and XBP1s splicing 124 showing that the lumenal domain of 19K is required for IRE1 activation. HeLa cells expressing 125 Flag-tagged full length (FL) and lumenal domain (LD) of 19K were fixed with PFA and 126 immunostained for Flag. Representative images show reticular staining patterns from 127 expression of Flag-tagged 19K FL and LD constructs at low magnification (Scale bar, 100 µm, 128 fluorescence micrographs). Three independent experiments gave similar results. Source data 129 are provided as a source data file. 130 h. ER retention motif of C2 19K-LD is not required for XBP1 splicing. HeLa cells expressing 131 Flag-tagged lumenal domain (LD) constructs of C2 19K-LD with or without the retention signal 132 HDEL were fixed with PFA and immunostained for Flag. Parallel samples were anlaysed for 133 XBP1 splicing. Expression efficiency is depicted as percentage of Flag-expressing cells and 134 representative images show reticular staining pattern of these constructs (Scale bar, 100 and 135 50 µm for overview and zoomed in fluorescence micrographs respectively). Data represent the 136 means from two independent experiments. Source data are provided as a source data file. 137 i. AdV-C2 19K activates IRE1α more effectively than AdV-D8 19K. HeLa cells expressing 138 Flag-tagged lumenal domain (LD) and full-length C2-19K and D8-19K were fixed with PFA and 139 immunostained for Flag. Flag expression levels were quantified and results displayed in a 140 scatter plot (n=1888 and 1414 for C2 LD-19K and D8 LD-19K, respectively). Centre line 141 indicates median and 1 st and 3 rd quartiles and whiskers shown as boxes and lines, 142respectively. Significance was assessed with two-tailed Wilcoxon non-parametric test.

FIGREF2.text: -length 19K, IRE1α and GFP1-9 constructs used for the split-GFP complementation. 158 Human embryonic kidney (HEK) 293T cells were seeded for 24 h and transfected with 100 ng 159 of plasmid DNA encoding AdV-C2 or D8 19K-G10, Flag-IRE1-G11-CD and GFP1-9 for 48 h. 160 Cells were fixed and stained with 4′,6-Diamidin-2-phenylindol (DAPI) and imaged with high-161 throughput microscopy. GFP signals from the positive cells were quantified using CellProfiler 162 and plotted along with the total cell numbers. Zoomed-in regions in top panels show lesser 163 split-GFP complementation of 19K and IRE1α with D8 19K compared to C2 19K. Scale bars 164 are 10 and 100 µm for the zoom in and overview images, respectively. The quantification of 165 GFP signals is shown in the right panel. 166 c. Weaker interaction of D8 19K-LD with IRE1α-LD than C2 LD-19K. HEK293T cells were 167 transfected with CMV-mCherry, SS-GFP1-9-HDEL, IRE1a-LD-GFP10 and C2 or D8 19K-LD-168 GFP11. Forty-eight hours post transfection, cells were imaged live with high-throughput 169 spinning disk confocal with 20X objective. Cells were segmented with Cell profiler using 170 mCherry signal as a mask and split-GFP signal was measured over this mask. Split GFP 171 intensity in cells that are above the background intensity of GFP are plotted as a scatter plot 172 here. Expression of C2 and D8 19K-LD-GFP11 was analysed in parallel using SS-GFP1-10-173 HDEL plasmid which forms bipartite GFP complementation with proteins tagged with GFP11. 174 Five hundred random cells per conditions were chosen to make the box plot, with central line 175 indicating the median and 1 st and 3 rd quartiles and whiskers shown as boxes and lines, 176 respectively. Percentage GFP positive cells are indicated and the test of significance was 177 performed using Wilcoxon non-parametric test. RNAi, live cell assay demonstrating the suppression of AdV gene 184 expression in persistence, and cytopathic effects of IRE1α nuclease inhibition 185 and XBP1 RNAi in HDF-TERT cells. (Relates to Figure 5). 186 a. Lentiviruses encoding murine XBP1s. Schematics showing the domains of murine XBP1s in 187 wild-type (cl8) and mutant (cl7) constructs encoding full length XBP1s and XBP1s devoid of 188 the activation domain, respectively. Middle panel shows the expression of XBP1s mRNA from 189 both of the constructs. Note that the protein expression of full-length XBP1s is seen only in the 190 wild-type construct. The bottom panels show the increase in AdV-C2 E1A levels in cl8 191 expressing HeLa I-KO cells, not in the cl7 expressing cells. Three independent experiments 192 gave similar results. 193 b. Knock-down efficiency of IRE1α and XBP1 upon RNAi (siTools, 20 nM) in HDF-TERT cells. 194 Quantitative reverse transcriptase (qrt) PCR of total IRE1α and XBP1 mRNA levels in 195 siIRE1α and siXBP1 transfected HDF-TERT cells 72 h post transfection relative to the non-196 targeting control siPools (siNeg1). Data represent the means from two independent 197 experiments. 198 c. Suppression of AdV-C5_GFP-E4orf4 expression in IFN-γ treated HDF-TERT cells in long-199 term persistence. Cells were seeded onto 96-well imaging plates for 24 h, incubated with IFN-γ 200 for 24 h and infected with AdV-C5_GFP-E4orf4 at 37°C for 1 h. Unbound virus was washed 201 out and cells were incubated with IFN-γ with subsequent replacement of IFN-γ every 5 days. 202 Representative images from parallel samples show cells fixed 14 days pi, stained with DAPI 203 and imaged with high-throughput microscopy. Scale bars are 500 µm. Right panel shows 204 percentage of GFP-E4orf4 expressing cells in IFN-γ treated and untreated cells from a replica 205 experiment, imaged live at indicated times points and quantified with Cell Profiler. Data 206 represent the means from two technical replicates. Two independent experiments gave similar 207 results. 208 d. Impedance measurements with xCELLigence showing effects of 4µ8C and XBP1 RNAi on 209 HDF-TERT cells. Cells were seeded onto xCELLigence E-16 plates for 24 h, and either 210 transfected with RNAi against XBP1, non-targeting control siRNA (siNeg1, 20 nM each) or 211 incubated with 4µ8C (0.1 mM). Live cell impedance measurements were taken at intervals of 212 15 minutes. Drug was washed out 7 days post incubation, and impedance measurements 213 were continued for another 5 days. Data represent the means +/-SD from three technical 214 replicates. Two independent experiments gave similar results.

FIGREF3.text: 200 each), and unbound virus was removed by washing cells with medium. 224 Viral DNA copy numbers in the supernatant were calculated using qPCR at 216 h pi (or 300 h 225 post seeding). Data are represented as mean from two technical replicates. Two independent 226 experiments gave similar results. 227 b. C5-dl309 and AdV-C5 is more cytopathic than C5-dl309-∆63-195 and AdV-C5-XBP1s-mut, 228 respectively. Cell viability of the cells from (A) was determined with xCELLigence in 15 min 229 intervals at MOI 200 each. (Also relates to Figure 7). Data are represented as mean +/-SD 230 from three technical replicates. Two independent experiments gave similar results. infection with AdV-C2 (MOI 240) for 72 h. Cells were fixed and stained for AdV late 242 protein VI and DAPI. Scale bar, 100 µm. Two independent experiments gave similar results. 243 b. E1A and protein VI expressions in long-term persistent C5-dl309 and C5-dl309-∆63-195 244 infected cells (MOI 200 each). Representative images showing E1A and protein VI 245 expressions in dl309 (IFN-γ-treated) and dl309-∆63-195 (IFN-γ treated or drug-free) infected 246 HDF-TERT cells. Experimental conditions were as described in Figure 7c, but IFN-γ treated 247 cells were fixed at 420 h and 870 h pi (IFN-γ washout at 546 h pi), stained for E1A (M58) or 248protein VI and imaged with high-throughput microscopy. Scale bar, 100 µm.
